channel.title: 508 timer, help please :)?
channel.description:
so .. how do i make a timer.. not a clickdelay but like when i press an emote or something like that it will do the emote and after like 3 secs it would do another emote without im clicking on other emotes :)
im using davidscape source:) PLEASE HELP ME :)
EDIT: i got one more question .. lets say i have this special p.points.. they are attatchet to an interface like it says : you have 1000 points but when i buy stuff from that interface the interface dosent update the points so if i bought for like 100 pts it would still say 1000 until i reopen the interface . some one help me fix ?

i dont have a file called evenmanager?? or actionmanager ? omg …

item.title: 508 timer, help please :)?

item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

[quote=“klump, post:17, topic:456798”][quote author=emtrescue link=topic=559738.msg4089023#msg4089023 date=1346134334]
one you use to show in interface
[/quote]

p.frames.setString(p, “.txt " + p.SlayerPoints + " txt.”, 164, 20);[/quote]

find

public void process() { if (action != null) { if (player.isDead()) { forceStop(); } else if (!action.process(player)) { forceStop(); } }

in evenmanager.java

add

public void process() { p.frames.setString(p, ".txt " + p.SlayerPoints + " txt.", 164, 20); if (action != null) { if (player.isDead()) { forceStop(); } else if (!action.process(player)) { forceStop(); } }

i’ll give you the 316 bit

autoupdate;

Click logout (id shows on server)
that id number is under processes.[/quote]

.\DavidScape\players\Player.java:2584: ‘;’ expected
public void autoupdate()
^
.\DavidScape\players\Player.java:2586: ‘;’ expected
public void process()
^
.\DavidScape\players\Player.java:2980: process() is already defined in DavidScap
e.players.Player
